stream_context.summary: Kaze live-edits the volcanic section of Return to Yoshi’s Island, experimenting with rock textures, grass transitions and shader blends while chatting about recent beta tests, new sound effects and project progress.

development_findings.summary: A completely remade sound engine is now in place, allowing Kaze to begin importing ambience and SFX created by Badub; he demonstrated new propeller and windmill sounds.
development_findings.quote: The sound engine is completely remade, we can add sound effects everywhere.

development_findings.summary: First private beta of Course 4 received positive feedback but exposed a soft-lock bug and a ‘plane mission’ that testers disliked, prompting a planned redesign with Biobak.
development_findings.quote: The testers liked it more than I thought they would … but the plane mission sucks, so we need to think of something new.

development_findings.summary: Kaze published a public Google-sheet progress tracker that lists each course’s completion percentage to reduce repetitive release-date questions and will update it regularly.
development_findings.quote: If you want to track progress in RTYI, you can look at this spreadsheet … I'm probably going to start tweeting this out.

development_findings.summary: Current overall course completion (from the sheet): most main courses 90-100 %, remaining tasks include Course 4 polishing (25 %), several 75 % areas, and future Biobak graphical reworks.
Fast64 lighting bug (yellow/red light, lighthouse issue) blocks certain edits; Kaze is waiting on tool authors for a fix.
development_findings.quote: This is a Fast64 bug … they need to fix the program, I can't do much right now.

development_findings.summary: Texture work: decided volcanic cliffs will show horizontal lava layering on one side and regular rock on the other, with grass caps to keep the Yoshi’s Island aesthetic.
Final ROM must run on EverDrive; Kaze is confident he can resolve the current crash before release.
development_findings.quote: I do plan on figuring out why the overdrive crashes … feeling fairly confident that I can fix it.

development_findings.summary: Kaze expects only one in-game volcanic eruption for story purposes.
development_findings.quote: It only erupts once and it's like for kind of story reasons.

context_findings.summary: Kaze felt over-scheduled recently but is regaining personal ‘freedom’ to focus on the hack.
context_findings.quote: I feel like I finally have my freedom back.

context_findings.summary: He dislikes making YouTube videos but does so for income, acknowledging the trade-off with development time.
context_findings.quote: I hate making videos. But it's good money.

context_findings.summary: Kaze emphasises living on real income, not just passion projects.
context_findings.quote: Unfortunately I am a real human in the real world and I do need to collect money to survive.

context_findings.summary: He identifies strongly with legacy hardware philosophy, arguing new consoles are ‘expensive garbage hardware’ compared to exploring one platform deeply.
context_findings.quote: I am the N64 man so obviously I believe that console software was good enough ten years ago and we didn't need any more upgrades.

biobak.summary: Primary role is graphic reworks; upcoming passes may alter completed courses without breaking gameplay.
biobak.quote: Biobak rework is just him updating the graphics … he does make some gameplay changes, but they are all very simple to accommodate.

biobak.summary: Collaborated with Kaze during stream chat on selecting realistic yet Mario-friendly volcanic rock textures.

badub.summary: Provided new ambient sound effects now being integrated thanks to the rebuilt sound engine.
badub.quote: I recently started importing some of Badub's sound effects.

key_stories.title: Course 4 Beta Wake-Up Call
key_stories.summary: After months of building Course 4, Kaze sent a first beta to testers. Feedback was positive overall, but a persistent soft-lock bug and an unpopular plane mission emerged.
key_stories.challenge: Soft-locks and unfun objective threatened course quality.
key_stories.process: Kaze reviewed tester reports, reproduced the issues and brainstormed redesign ideas with Biobak.
key_stories.outcome: Soft-lock slated for fix; plane mission will be re-conceptualised before next beta.
key_stories.key_quote: We finally got the first beta test for Course 4 … there's one very frustrating bug, and the plane mission sucks.

key_stories.title: Rebuilding the Soundscape
key_stories.summary: A full rewrite of the game’s sound engine unlocked proper ambient audio. Kaze began importing Badub’s new effects, instantly making areas feel more alive.
key_stories.challenge: Original engine limitations prevented rich ambient SFX.
key_stories.process: Complete engine rewrite, followed by integrating new samples one by one.
key_stories.outcome: Propeller and windmill ambience successfully demonstrated; wider rollout planned.
key_stories.key_quote: The little propeller sound makes it feel so much more alive to me.

key_stories.title: Managing Hype with a Public Tracker
key_stories.summary: Constant demands for a release date frustrated Kaze. He responded by publishing an online spreadsheet that reveals percent-complete status for every course.
key_stories.challenge: Repetitive community questions about release timing.
key_stories.process: Compiled internal progress data into a Google Sheet; shared link on stream.
key_stories.outcome: Fans can self-check progress; Kaze plans regular updates and tweets.
key_stories.key_quote: You can track the progress … and there's no release date. It's going to release when it's done.
